intro: Campteria anamallayensis, commonly known as the Anamallayensis campteria, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and is known for its ornamental value. Its unique floral structure and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires protection to ensure its survival.
